rename.from: using OneDrive with chunker and crypt results in 0/s
rename.to: using OneDrive with chunker and crypt results in stalled transfers

body:
Are the transfers actually stalled or is it just the stats being wrong - can you tell by looking at your outgoing bandwidth?

@ivandeex any thoughts on this?

@ncw I have reverted back to using crypt only, since my OneDrive business account actually does take files up to 100GB in size now, so I no longer have use for chunker. However, I set up another of my OneDrive accounts with chunker just for testing and it worked just fine. I guess this can be closed.

@kultigspritzig ok let's mark it "does not reproduce"

@ncw maybe we can add a "onedrive + crypt + chunker" config to the integration suite?

> maybe we can add a "onedrive + crypt + chunker" config to the integration suite?

That is a reasonable idea!

I decided to go with chunker enabled after all due to a lot of my bigger uploads running out of the 24h upload window. I immediately run into the same issue. Therefore the problem here is that I cannot enable chunker for an en existing endpoint.

EDIT: there's no networking activity from rclone, although it does hog the CPU (15-20%), so there is some computational activity
@ivandeex I am happy to help debugging this, just need some pointers where to start.

@kultigspritzig

I believe that your pre-transfer delays occur due to chunker hashing large files (since hash_type=md5). Most remotes keep file hashsum in a special file meta-tags and return it immediately when chunker requests it before transfer, but **local** filesystem is a prominent exception. It reports to chunker that hashsum is available but calculates it on-the-fly resulting in substantial delay if the file is large. During calculation is see no traffic but high CPU load. 

I applied this https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/commit/9751eaf02b4690f2e291b88c215016423347bc0d experimental patch and created a beta build, which you can download here https://github.com/ivandeex/rclone/releases/tag/v1.51.onedrivedelay1 to investigate your case.

The beta explicitly prints hashsum calculation time and additionally supports a special flag `--chunker-hash-nodelay`, which makes chunker revert to in-transit hashsum calculation if the source file is local, this avoiding the delay.

Example of uploading a 1GB file to onedrive+crypt+chunker with the beta:
```
$ du -hs file1
1005M   file1
$ ./rclone copy -P -v ./file1 onedrive1chunk:
2020-05-18 18:52:00 INFO  : file1: start hashing MD5 ...
2020-05-18 18:52:03 INFO  : file1: hashing MD5 took 3.053437235s
2020-05-18 18:53:37 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.001_jfupnt: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:53:37 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.002_jfupnt: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:53:38 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.003_jfupnt: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:53:39 INFO  : file1: Copied (new)
Transferred:     1004.260M / 1004.260 MBytes, 100%, 10.186 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Elapsed time:      1m38.5s
```
And this is how `--chunk-hash-nodelay` affects transfers:
```
$ ./rclone deletefile onedrive1chunk:file1
$ ./rclone copy --chunker-hash-nodelay -P -v ./build/file1 onedrive1chunk:
2020-05-18 18:05:38 INFO  : file1: skip long MD5 on local file, hashing in-transit
2020-05-18 18:06:53 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.001_jdpcxu: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:06:53 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.002_jdpcxu: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:06:55 INFO  : file1.rclone_chunk.003_jdpcxu: Moved (server side)
2020-05-18 18:06:56 INFO  : file1: Copied (new)
Elapsed time:      1m17.8s
```

Here is my configuration:
```
$ tail -20 ~/.config/rclone/rclone.conf
[onedrive1]
type = onedrive
token = {"access_token"...}
drive_id = ...
drive_type = personal
[onedrive1crypt]
type = crypt
remote = onedrive1:crypt
filename_encryption = standard
directory_name_encryption = true
password = ...
password2 = ...
[onedrive1chunk]
type = chunker
remote = onedrive1crypt:
chunk_size = 500M
hash_type = md5
```

Please check it out and tell me if it solves your problem.
